{{About|the American socialite|her self-titled fragrance|Paris Hilton (fragrance)|the hotel chain, which has hotels in Paris, France|Hilton Hotels}} {{pp-move-indef|small=yes}}{{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox person | name = Paris Hilton | image = Paris Hilton 2009.jpg | image_size = | caption = Hilton at the [[Fox Reality Channel]] Really Awards on October 13, 2009 in Hollywood, CA. | birth_name = Paris Whitney Hilton | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1981|2|17|}} | birth_place = New York City, New York, United States | occupation = Businesswoman, socialite, fashion designer. | years_active = 1993, 2000–present | networth = $100 million (as of 2012) | height = {{height|ft=5|in=8}} | weight = {{convert|115|lb|kg st|abbr=on}} | religion = Roman Catholic | parents = [[Richard Hilton|Richard Howard Hilton]]
[[Kathy Hilton]] | website = [http://www.parishilton.com/ Official site] }} '''Paris Whitney Hilton''' (born February 17, 1981){{cite web|url = http://www.filmreference.com/film/88/Paris-Hilton.html | title=Paris Hilton Biography (1981–) | publisher = FilmReference.com | accessdate= September 20, 2012}} is an American socialite, businesswoman, fashion designer and musician. She is the great-granddaughter of [[Conrad Hilton]], the founder of [[Hilton Hotels]]. Born in New York City and raised in California and New York, Hilton began a modeling career as a teenager when she was with [[Donald Trump]]'s modeling agency, T Management. Her hard-partying lifestyle and rumoured short-lived relationships with [[Leonardo DiCaprio]] and [[Oscar de la Hoya]] led her to earn a position as a daily fixture in entertainment news – gossip-section Page Six, of the ''[[New York Post]]'' often includes articles about Hilton. Being known as a socialite, Hilton was hailed by the media as "New York's leading [[It Girl]]" in 2001.{{cite web|author=Times shown are ET |url=http://www.biography.com/people/paris-hilton-11271420?page=1 |title=Paris Hilton Biography – Facts, Birthday, Life Story |publisher=Biography.com |date=February 17, 1981 |accessdate=2012-08-10}} She went on to make cameo appearances in ''[[Zoolander]]'' (2001), ''[[Wonderland (film)|Wonderland]]'' and ''[[The Cat in the Hat (film)|The Cat in the Hat]]'' (both 2003). Hilton gained significant notoriety for a [[1 Night in Paris|sex tape]], which was released in November 2003, shortly before the premiere of the television reality series ''[[The Simple Life]]'' alongside fellow socialite and childhood best friend [[Nicole Richie]]. The show was a massive hit for the FOX network, premiering with 13 million viewers,{{cite web|url=http://www.realitytvworld.com/news/fox-the-simple-life-premiere-draws-13-million-viewers-and-night-highest-adults-18-49-rating-2050.php |title=FOX's 'The Simple Life' premiere draws 13 million viewers and the night's highest Adults 18–49 rating |publisher=Realitytvworld.com |accessdate=2012-09-05}} and brought Hilton and co-star Richie to an international recognition. She then released her 2004 [[tongue-in-cheek]] autobiography called ''[[Confessions of an Heiress: A Tongue-in-Chic Peek Behind the Pose]]'',[http://search.barnesandnoble.com/booksearch/isbninquiry.asp?r=1&ean=9780743266642 Barnes and Noble: "Confessions of an Heiress: A Tongue-in-Chic Peek behind the Pose"]. Search.barnesandnoble.com. Retrieved on 2011-10-28. she landed a supporting role in the 2005 horror film ''[[House of Wax (2005 film)|House of Wax]]'', and recorded the 2006 music album ''[[Paris (Paris Hilton album)|Paris]]''. She starred in the reality show ''[[Paris Hilton's My New BFF]]'' which was filmed in 2008 and also resulted in a second season. The show proved to be a success and was branched out to 2009's ''[[Paris Hilton's British Best Friend]]'' and ''[[Paris Hilton’s Dubai BFF]]''. Hilton was in 2008's ''[[Repo! The Genetic Opera]]'', where her work gained critical acclaim. She has appeared in various lists compiled by magazines such as ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'', ''[[FHM]]'' as well as ''[[Stuff (magazine)|Stuff]]''. She is also regularly placed on lists composed by ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine and was named one of the "100 Hottest Women of All-Time" by ''[[Men's Health (magazine)|Men's Health]]''.{{cite web|title=The 100 Hottest Women of All-Time|url=http://www.menshealth.com/sex-women/hottest-women-all-time|work=[[Men's Health (magazine)|Men's Health]]|accessdate=January 3, 2012|year=2011}} Critics also suggest that Hilton epitomizes the title of [[famous for being famous]];[http://www.scoreboard-media.com/paris-hilton-rule/ "The Paris Hilton Rule: Famous For Being Famous"]. ScoreboardMedia (February 6, 2007). Retrieved on 2011-10-28. she is an example of the modern phenomenon of the "[[celebutante]]", the celebrity who rises to fame not because of their talent or work but because of their inherited wealth and controversial lifestyle. Being crear from tabloid headlines in recent years, she has parlayed her media fame into a fashion line and various perfumes with her [[testimonial|celebrity endorsement]] — her fragrances have reportedly earned $1.5 billion. Currently, there are 55 Paris Hilton Stores worldwide and her brand includes, in addition to perfumes, handbags, watches, footwear, among others. She earns over $10 million a year from her products sales{{cite news|url=http://articles.businessinsider.com/2011-06-01/entertainment/30076238_1_piers-morgan-paris-hilton-product-lines|title=SURPRISE? Paris Hilton Earns Over $10M A Year From 17 Different Product Lines|publisher=Articles.businessinsider.com|accessdate=July 31, 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://articles.cnn.com/2011-05-31/entertainment/piers.morgan.paris.hilton_1_hotel-heiress-paris-hilton-rick-salomon/2?_s=PM:SHOWBIZ|title=Paris Hilton on sex tape: 'I'll never be able to erase it'|publisher=CNN|accessdate=July 31, 2012|date=February 15, 2006}} and as of 2005 she was paid $300,000 for appearances in clubs and events.{{cite news| url=http://www.forbes.com/lists/2005/53/U3HH.html | work=Forbes}} Her net worth is estimated to be $100 million as of 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.therichest.org/celebnetworth/celeb/model/paris-hilton-net-worth/ |title=Paris Hilton Net Worth 2012 | Celebrity Net Worth |publisher=Therichest.org |date=February 17, 1981 |accessdate=2012-08-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.celebritynetworth.com/richest-celebrities/paris-hilton-net-worth/ |title=Paris Hilton Net Worth |publisher=Celebrity Net Worth |date=February 17, 1981 |accessdate=2012-08-10}} ==Early life and education== [[File:Kathy Hilton, Paris Hilton and Kyle Richards at NBC party at TCA.jpg|thumb|right|Hilton with her mother [[Kathy Hilton]] and aunt [[Kyle Richards]] at an [[NBC]] party on February 5, 2011.]] Hilton was born in New York City, New York. Her mother, [[Kathy Hilton]] (née Kathleen Elizabeth Avanzino),[http://articles.nydailynews.com/2006-11-07/entertainment/18344888_1_nicky-hilton-hilton-foundation-hilton-hotel-fortune "Chronicling the history of the hideously hyped inn crowd"]. ''New York Daily News''. November 7, 2006.''House of Hilton'' by Jerry Oppenheimer. is a socialite and former actress, and her father, [[Richard Hilton|Richard Howard "Rick" Hilton]], is a businessman. She is the oldest of four children: she has one sister, [[Nicky Hilton|Nicholai Olivia "Nicky" Hilton]] (born 1983), and two brothers, Barron Nicholas Hilton II (born 1989) and Conrad Hughes Hilton III (born 1994). Her paternal great-grandfather was [[Conrad Hilton]], who founded the [[Hilton Hotels & Resorts|Hilton Hotels]]. She is of Norwegian, German, Italian (from a maternal great-grandfather), English, and Irish ancestry.[http://www.wargs.com/other/hilton.html Ancestry of Paris Hilton]. Wargs.com. Retrieved on 2011-10-28.{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BMjf-vZ84KQ |title=Video of Hilton declaring her ethnicity |publisher=''Youtube'' |date=June 29, 2007 |accessdate=2012-09-05}}{{cite news| url=http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/projo/access/31911812.html?dids=31911812:31911812&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Feb+20%2C+1997&author=&pub=The+Providence+Journal&desc=Providence+LAURENCE+K.+AVANZINO&pqatl=google | work=Providence Journal | title=Providence LAURENCE K. AVANZINO | date=February 20, 1997}}{{cite news| url=http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/projo/access/39692575.html?dids=39692575:39692575&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Mar+12%2C+1999&author=&pub=The+Providence+Journal&desc=Narragansett+ELIZABETH+J.+AVANZINO&pqatl=google | work=The Providence Journal | title=Narragansett ELIZABETH J. AVANZINO | date=March 12, 1999}} She is a half-niece of two child stars of the 1970s, [[Kim Richards|Kim]] and [[Kyle Richards]]. She was raised Roman Catholic and still attends [[Latin Mass|Mass]].{{cite news| url=http://www.cnn.com/2007/SHOWBIZ/TV/06/27/king.hilton.transcript/index.html | work=CNN | title=Paris Hilton on 'Larry King Live' - CNN.com}}{{cite news| url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2006/jul/08/popandrock | location=London |work=The Guardian | first=Simon | last=Hattenstone | title=Simon Hattenstone meets Paris Hilton | date=July 8, 2006}} Hilton moved between numerous exclusive homes in her youth, including a suite in the [[Waldorf-Astoria Hotel]] in [[Manhattan]], [[Beverly Hills, California|Beverly Hills]], and [[the Hamptons]]. As a child she was good friends with other socialites, including [[Nicole Richie]] and [[Kim Kardashian]].{{cite web| url = http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0385296/bio| title = Biography for Paris Hilton| publisher = IMDb| accessdate = April 2, 2011}} Growing up in Los Angeles, Hilton attended the [[Buckley School (California)|Buckley School]] and the exclusive [[St. Paul the Apostle Church and School]], where she graduated in 1995.{{cite news| url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/picturegalleries/celebritynews/8720360/School-yearbook-pictures-of-celebrities.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | title=School yearbook pictures of celebrities | date=August 24, 2011}} She then attended her freshman year of high school at the [[Marywood-Palm Valley school|Marywood-Palm Valley School]] in [[Rancho Mirage]], California from 1995–1996. In 1996, when Hilton was 14 years old, her family moved to the East Coast.{{cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/articles/Paris-Hilton-11271420|title=Paris Hilton Biography|publisher=A&E Television Network|work=Biography.com|year=2011|accessdate=April 2, 2011}} In New York, she briefly attended [[Convent of the Sacred Heart (New York)|Convent of the Sacred Heart]] (while [[Lady Gaga]] was a student there) in 1996 before transferring again to the [[Dwight School]].{{cite web|url=http://dancemusic.about.com/od/artistshomepages/a/LadyGagaInt_2.htm |title=Interview with Lady Gaga|first=Ron|last=Slomowicz|publisher=About.com|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=September 11, 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://www.metrolyrics.com/paris-hilton-biography.html|title=Paris Hilton Biography|publisher=Metro Lyrics|accessdate = April 2, 2011}} At 16, Hilton spent one year at the [[Provo Canyon School]], a school for emotionally troubled teens.{{cite news|url=http://www.chicagoflame.com/2.9141/the-real-news-1.1299436|title=The Real News – Paris Hilton: I need a disguise|work=Chicago Flame|date=December 7, 2003|accessdate=April 2, 2011}}{{cite news|url=http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/entertainment/paris-hiltons-teen-lover-threatens-to-expose-their-love-letters_1005218.html|title=Paris Hilton’s teen lover threatens to expose their love letters|work=Thiandian News|date=November 15, 2007|accessdate=April 2, 2011}} She then attended the [[Canterbury School (New Milford, Connecticut)|Canterbury Boarding School]], in [[New Milford, Connecticut]] from the fall of 1998 to February 1999 for her junior year, where she was a member of the [[ice hockey]] team.{{cite web|url=http://www.wnd.com/2007/06/42071/ |title=Paris Hilton was high-school hockey ‘sensation’ |publisher=Wnd.com |date=June 14, 2007 |accessdate=2012-05-24}} In February 1999, the month she turned 18, she was expelled from Canterbury for violating school rules. After being expelled from Canterbury, she returned to the Dwight School before dropping out a few months later as a high school junior. She later earned her [[GED]].{{Cite news|first=Evonne|last=Barry|title=A million reasons to be Paris|date=December 30, 2006|url=http://www.news.com.au/story/0,23599,20990279-5007146,00.html|work=The Daily Telegraph (Australia)|accessdate=February 1, 2007}}{{Cite news|title=Paris Hilton Biography|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,195187,00.html?sPage=fnc/entertainment/celebrity/hilton|publisher=Fox News|date=June 28, 2007|accessdate=July 4, 2008}} ==Entertainment career== ===2000–2002: Early work=== Hilton began modeling as a child, initially at charity events. When she was 19, she signed with [[Donald Trump]]'s modeling agency, T Management. Hilton stated that while she "wanted to model," Trump was wishing to have her at his agency, and after she signed she was "loving" the work. Hilton has also worked with [[Ford Models]] in New York, [[Models 1|Models 1 Agency]] in London, [[Nous Model Management]] in Los Angeles, and [[Premier Model Management]] in London. She has appeared in numerous advertising campaigns, including [[Iceberg Vodka]], [[Guess?|GUESS]], [[Tommy Hilfiger]], [[Christian Dior]], and [[Marciano Stores|Marciano]]. In 2001, Hilton began to develop a reputation as a socialite, being identified as "New York's leading It Girl" whose fame was beginning to "extend beyond the New York [[Tabloid (newspaper format)|tabloid]]s".{{Cite news| last = Porter|first = Charlie|title = New York style: 'Is this article going to trash me?': Heiress, star of the social columns and now a top model.. Charlie Porter meets Paris Hilton|work=The Guardian (London)|pages = Guardian Features Pages, p. 8 |date=February 16, 2001}} She has appeared in several magazines, including ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]'', the April 2004 issue of ''[[Maxim magazine|Maxim]]''[http://www.maximonline.com/Parishilton/girls_of_maxim/69.aspx?src=GM7070:MD Paris Hilton's girl gallery]{{dead link|date=October 2011}} and the October 2005 cover of ''[[Stuff (magazine)|Stuff]]''. Hilton started to act by doing cameo appearances in films such as ''[[Zoolander]]'' (2001). In 2002, she was one of the leads in the [[straight-to-video]] horror movie ''[[Nine Lives (2002 film)|Nine Lives]]''. The film did well in sales. ''Beyondhollywood.com'' felt that "Hilton’s presence in the cast is the film’s main marketing point, which is plainly obvious by the fact that she’s front and center on the box art and is the only recognizable name in the cast" and also noted that her character was basically herself: "Hilton plays — what else? — a spoiled American socialite who shops on three continents in one day. The script is even clever enough to take a few jabs at Hilton’s real-life social standing, even mentioning that she’s been on the cover of a few sleaze rags in her day".{{cite web|url=http://www.beyondhollywood.com/nine-lives-2002-movie-review/|title=Nine Lives (2002) Movie Review|publisher=Beyondhollywood.com|accessdate=Aril 29, 2012}} ===2003–2005: Career breakthrough=== Hilton's breakout role came in 2003, when she co-starred with socialite counterpart [[Nicole Richie]] in the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] reality series ''[[The Simple Life]]'', which premiered on December 2, 2003, shortly after Hilton's sex tape was released.{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,26334,627219,00.html|title='Simple Life' Establishes Hilton's Star|work=People|accessdate=April 6, 2012}} The show started airing to surprisingly well received ratings; the premiere episode drew 13,000,000 viewers, increasing Fox's Adults 18–49 rating a phenomenal 79%. "everyone likes it because it's for all ages. People from the city will be like, 'Oh my God, I cannot believe you did that,' and people from the country think it's funny because they do it every day",{{cite web|last=Silverman |first=Stephen M. |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,627850,00.html |title=Hilton and Richie Expand Their Horizons – The Simple Life, Nicole Richie, Paris Hilton |work=People |date=March 15, 2004 |accessdate=2012-05-24}} Hilton said about the reason why the show was successful. Some entertainment writers felt the overnight success of Hilton was spawned by the whole tape controversy. ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' commented: "I dare say the Paris Hilton-Rick Salomon tape received more print and television coverage in a week than the run-up to ''The Simple Life'' received in the months since its premiere was announced. We in the media have become Paris-ites".{{cite news|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,535692,00.html|title=The Simple Life Review|work=Entertainment Weekly|accessdate=May 18, 2012|date=December 4, 2003}} ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine wrote that the show "no doubt was helped by the very public saga of a pirated three-year-old video tape, which recently made the rounds on the Internet showing Hilton engaged in various sex acts with ex-boyfriend Rick Salomon". At that time, she started to be recognizable for her onscreen [[dumb blonde]] persona in reality television. According to UK's ''[[Now (magazine)|Now]]'' magazine, in a 2009 interview she said that "For five seasons I was stuck doing this character. It was kind of hard always having to play that character when it's not who I am".{{cite news|url=http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/celebrity-news/people/299518/paris-hilton-insists-she-s-not-stupid/1|title=Paris Hilton insists she's not stupid|publisher=Now magazine|accessdate=May 18, 2012}} In a January 2011 interview with ''[[Movieline]]'', she remarked: "In ''The Simple Life'', producers told me to play a dumb blonde and that's what I did. I didn't realize at the time that I'd have to do that for five seasons and keep up this character of me. I think people assume that that is how I am in real life but I'm actually quite a businesswoman".{{cite news|url=http://movieline.com/2011/01/14/paris-hilton-plays-movielines-my-favorite-scene/|title=Paris Hilton Plays My Favorite Scene: 'Who Was It? Ben Stiller or Matt Damon?'|publisher=Movieline.com|accessdate=May 18, 2012}} Hilton launched a [[lifestyle brand]] in 2004. She helped design a collection of purses for Japanese label [[Samantha Thavasa]]. The 10-piece line collection, a jewelry line designed by Hilton, started being on sale on [[Amazon.com]].[http://msnbc.msn.com/id/5888425/ Paris Hilton creates jewelry line] ''Msnbc.msn.com'' "I grew up surrounded by the finest fashion and jewelry designs, and I really wanted to create a line that was beautiful and very high quality, yet affordable and available to everyone," Hilton stated. "This jewelry is for the heiress in everyone."{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,691014,00.html|title=Paris Hilton Launches Her Own Jewelry Line|publisher=People.coom|accessdate=March 16, 2012}} The line was described as "inspired by Hilton's personal style – feminine, flirtatious and glamorous – with heart, star and cross motifs." She was involved in the creation of a perfume line by Parlux Fragrances. Originally set to be a small release, high demand led to a wider release before December 2004. The launch was followed by a 47% increase in sales of Parlux products, predominantly due to sales of the Hilton-branded perfume.[http://biz.yahoo.com/e/050815/parl10-q.html Form 10-Q for Parlux Fragrances, Inc.] ''Biz. Yahoo.com'' After the success of Hilton's perfume, Parlux Fragrances released several more perfumes with her name, including fragrances for men.[http://nowsmellthis.blogharbor.com/blog/_archives/2006/5/6/1936792.html Celebrity fragrance watch: Paris Hilton & Andy Roddick] ''Nowsmellthis.com'' In the autumn of 2004, Hilton released an autobiographical book, ''[[Confessions of an Heiress: A Tongue-in-Chic Peek Behind the Pose]]'',{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,688906,00.htm|title=Paris Dreams of Simple Life in New Book|work=People|accessdate=March 16, 2012}} co-written by Merle Ginsberg, which includes full color photographs of her and her advice on life as an heiress. She mentioned in the book she was looking for a simpler life: "I don't always want the glamorous, jet-set life," she wrote. "Someday soon, I want to have children and a big house with a lot of animals – like my parents had".{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,688906,00.html|title=Paris Dreams of Simple Life in New Book|work=People|accessdate=April 6, 2012}} Hilton reportedly received a $100,000 advance payment for this book. Some in the media panned the writing as amateurish, and the book was parodied by [[Robert Mundell]] on the ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]''. The book was in the ''[[The New York Times|New York Times]]'' [[New York Times Best Seller list|bestseller]] list, ranking at seven.{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2004/09/26/books/bestseller/0926besthardnonfiction.html|title=Hardcover Nonfiction|work=New York Times|accessdate=April 6, 2012|date=September 26, 2004}} The quote "Dress cute wherever you go; life is too short to blend in", which appeared in the book was added to [[The Oxford Dictionary of Quotations]] in September 2009.{{Cite news|url= http://www.reuters.com/article/artsNews/idUSTRE58A13N20090911|title=Paris Hilton's wisdom immortalized in book of quotes|publisher=Reuters|date=September 11, 2009|accessdate=September 13, 2009|first=Belinda|last=Goldsmith}} Hilton followed her book up with a designer diary, also with Ginsberg, called ''[[Your Heiress Diary: Confess It All to Me]]'' in 2005 and also in that year, she released her second fragrance ''[[Just Me (fragrance)|Just Me]]''. [[File:Paris Hilton.jpg|thumb|left|Hilton at the [[Cannes Film Festival]] on May 13, 2005.]] After Hilton hosted ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' with musical guest, band [[Keane (band)|Keane]] in February 2005,{{cite web|last=Silverman |first=Stephen M. |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1023613,00.html |title=Paris Hilton Booked to Host SNL – Paris Hilton |work=People |date=February 2, 2005 |accessdate=2012-05-24}} she got her first major role in the horror thriller film ''[[House of Wax (2005 film)|House of Wax]]'', in which [[Elisha Cuthbert]] and [[Chad Michael Murray]] also starred.{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,627841,00.html|title=Jen, Sarah and Paris to Hit Cineplex|work=People|accessdate=April 8, 2012}} The movie, after being first screened at the [[Tribeca Film Festival]],{{cite news|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2005-03-09/entertainment/18296417_1_tribeca-film-festival-movies-star|title=Tribeca film fest lineup|work=Daily News |location=New York |accessdate=April 8, 2012|date=March 9, 2005}} opened in May 2005,{{cite web|url=http://www.teenhollywood.com/2005/04/06/paris-hilton-turns-up-the-heat-on-house-of-wax |title=Paris Hilton Turns Up The Heat On House Of Wax |publisher=TeenHollywood.com |date=April 6, 2005 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} receiving mixed reviews.{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/house-of-wax|title=House of Wax reviews|publisher=Metacritic.com|accessdate=April 8, 2012}} Giving a positive review for her performance, Matthew Turner for the ''[[View London]]'' said that Hilton "does better than you might expect".{{cite web|url=http://www.viewlondon.co.uk/films/house-of-wax-film-review-11774.html|title=House of Wax Film Review|last=Turner|first=Matthew|work=ViewLondon|accessdate=November 27, 2011}} But while ''MTV'' felt that she was "actually pretty good",{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1501315/loder-house-wax-gory-classic-sorts.jhtml|title='House Of Wax,' 'Kingdom Of Heaven': Scary Smart, By Kurt Loder|publisher=''MTV''|accessdate=March 16, 2012}} ''[[TV Guide]]'' called Hilton "talentless".{{cite web|url=http://movies.tvguide.com/house-of-wax/review/137902|title=House of Wax Review|publisher=TV Guide|accessdate=July 27, 2012}} Her role as Paige Edwards won the [[Teen Choice Award]] for "Best Scream" and earned her a nomination for "Choice Breakout Performance – Female".[http://www.fox.com/tca2005/nominees.html Teen Choice Awards 2005 nominees and winners]. Fox.com (It also won her the 2005 [[Golden Raspberry Award|Razzie]] for "Worst Supporting Actress" at the [[2005 Golden Raspberry Awards]].)[http://www.razzies.com/forum/forum_posts.asp?TID=668&PN=1 2005 Golden Raspberry Award Nominees and Winners] on March 6, 2006 She also earned a nomination for "Best Frightened Performance" at the [[MTV Movie Awards 2006|2006 MTV Movie Awards]]. ''House of Wax'' grossed over $70,000,000.{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=houseofwax.htm|title=House of Wax (2005)|publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]]|accessdate=2007-06-17}} ''The Simple Life'', which ran for three seasons on FOX, was cancelled after a dispute between Hilton and Richie in 2005. Hilton commented: "It's no big secret that Nicole and I are no longer friends. Nicole knows what she did, and that's all I'm ever going to say about it."{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1052425,00.html|title=Paris Speaks Out About Split With Nicole|date=April 21, 2005|work=People|accessdate=2008-08-03}} Neither Richie nor Hilton spoke publicly about the cause of the split, though it was speculated that the pair fell out due to Richie showing one of Hilton's homemade sex tapes to a group of their friends.{{cite web|url=http://www.realitytvworld.com/news/simple-life-star-paris-hilton-confirms-that-%22nicole-and-i-are-no-longer-friends%22-3431.php |title='Simple Life' star Paris Hilton confirms that "Nicole and I are no longer friends" |publisher=Reality TV World |date=April 21, 2005 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} They renewed their friendship in October 2006.{{cite web|last=Alexander |first=Bryan |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1544365,00.html |title=Paris Hilton and Nicole Richie: Friends Again? – Nicole Richie, Paris Hilton |work=People |accessdate=2012-09-05}} ===2006–2008: Focus on music and film=== After Hilton founded Heiress Records, a sub-label of [[Warner Bros. Records]], in 2004, she released her self-titled debut album, ''[[Paris (Paris Hilton album)|Paris]]'', under the label on August 22, 2006. The album reached number six on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] for a week and sold over 600,000 copies worldwide{{cite web|url=http://www.parishiltonsite.net/music.php |title=Paris Hilton's Music |publisher=Parishiltonsite.net |accessdate=2012-09-05}} – the first single "[[Stars Are Blind]]" was a massive success around the globe{{cite web|url=http://www.teenmusic.com/2006/06/12/paris-hiltons-debut-single-is-a-hit |title=Paris Hilton's Debut Single is a Hit |publisher=TeenMusic.com |date=June 12, 2006 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} by being a top ten hit in 17 countries. Although ''[[The Guardian]]'' felt that Hilton sound "both distracted and bored stiff",{{cite news| url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2006/aug/11/popandrock.shopping8 | location=London |work=The Guardian | first=Alexis | last=Petridis | title=CD: Paris Hilton, Paris Hilton | date=August 10, 2006}} ''[[Allmusic]]'' commented that the album was "more fun than anything released by [[Britney Spears]] or [[Jessica Simpson]]". As a whole, critical reception was mixed.[http://web.archive.org/web/20090221120039/http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/discography/index.jsp?pid=699848&aid=788893 Discography – Paris Hilton – Paris CD/DVD] ''Billboard.com''{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/paris/critic-reviews|title=Reviews for Paris|publisher=Metacritic.com|accessdate=March 16, 2012}} The straight-to-DVD motion picture ''[[Bottoms Up (2006 film)|Bottoms Up]]'' was released in late 2006. The film came out with negative reviews; Australia's ''Urban Cinefile'' remarked that Hilton, as the lead role, "spends most of her screen time flicking her hair as she delivers lines like 'books are those things you read'".{{cite web|url=http://www.urbancinefile.com.au/home/view.asp?a=13735&s=DVD|title=BOTTOMS UP: DVD|publisher=Urban Cinefile|accessdate=April 29, 2012}} In December 2006, ''[[Pledge This!]]'', film in which Hilton appeared and produced, premiered in a limited release before going directly to video. She missed the premiere of the movie at the [[Cannes Film Festival]] in protest to the addition of some nude scenes that were going to be included in the film. Hilton said, "I was so angry I snubbed my own premiere."{{cite news |url = http://www.smh.com.au/news/people/waving-goodbye-to-her-wiced-ways/2006/05/30/1148956336143.html |title = Too much nudity, protests Paris |accessdate = 2006-05-30 |date = May 30, 2006 |work=The Sydney Morning Herald}} In August 2008, Worldwide Entertainment Group Inc. sued Hilton in the Miami District Court, alleging she did not honor her contractual agreement to provide "reasonable promotion and publicity" for the film.{{cite news |url = http://news.aol.com/entertainment/story/_a/paris-hilton-sued-over-lack-of-publicity/n20080812215209990008?ecid=RSS0001 |title = Paris Hilton sued over lack of publicity for film |accessdate = 2008-09-09 |date = August 12, 2008}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} It was reported she was paid $1,000,000 for her work. After ''The Simple Life'' was cancelled by FOX in 2005, it was subsequently aired by [[E! Entertainment Television]] for the fourth and fifth seasons.{{cite web|url=http://www.realitytvworld.com/news/fox-canceled-the-simple-life-4-reality-show-lands-at-e!-network-1006320.php |title=Fox's canceled 'The Simple Life 4' reality show lands at E! Network |publisher=Reality TV World |date=November 28, 2005 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} There were some complications to shoot the fifth season because of the arrests of both Hilton and co-star Richie in 2006. Despite talks of a sixth season,[http://www.parishiltonsite.net/simple-life-probably-picked-for-a-sixth-season/ Simple Life Probably Picked For A Sixth Season] on June 28, 2007 the series finished its run at the end of the fifth season in 2007.[http://tv.popcrunch.com/the-simple-life-cancelled/ ‘The Simple Life’ Cancelled] on July 30, 2007 The show brought high ratings for the network. In that year, Hilton modeled for 2 be free[http://www.imnotobsessed.com/2007/03/20/paris-hilton-strutted-her-stuff-on-the-2-b-free-runway/ Paris Hilton Strutted Her Stuff On The 2 B Free Runway]. Imnotobsessed.com (March 20, 2007). Retrieved on 2011-10-28. and her fourth perfume came out, called ''[[Can Can (fragrance)|Can Can]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.celebrity-mania.com/news/view/00002863.html |title=Paris Hilton's New Business Venture: Shoes |publisher=Celebrity-mania.com |date=August 1, 2007 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} In January 2007, Hilton released the DreamCatchers line of hair extensions in partnership with Hair Tech International.[http://web.archive.org/web/20070410090221/http://www.dreamcatchers.com/ParisHilton_AboutUs.html HAIR TECH INTERNATIONAL]. dreamcatchers.com In early August 2007, Hilton signed a licensing agreement with Antebi for a signature footwear line, "Paris Hilton Footwear", featuring stilettos, platforms, flats, wedges, and a sports collection, expected to reach stores in 2008.[http://goliath.ecnext.com/coms2/gi_0199-6807815/Paris-Hilton-Inks-Deal-with.html Paris Hilton Inks Deal with Antebi Footwear Group]. August 1, 2007. accessdate August 19, 2007 In mid August 2007, Hilton launched a line of tops, dresses, coats, and jeans at the [[Kitson Boutique]] in Los Angeles.[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/20305192/ Hilton's clothing launch sparks L.A. frenzy]. August 16, 2007. accessdate August 19, 2007 She felt the event was "a dream come true" and described the clothing line as " fun, bright and flashy".{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-476172/Paris-gets-gold-star-new-fashion-range.html|title=Paris gets a gold star for her new fashion range|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=March 19, 2012|location=London|date=August 18, 2007}} In December 2007, Hilton posed nude, covered in gold paint, to promote "Rich [[Prosecco]]", a canned version of an [[Italian wine|Italian]] sparkling wine.[http://www.tvshark.com/read/?art=arc1232 Paris Hilton Nude, Naked In Gold For Canned Champagne Ad – Rich Prosecco Wine]. TV Shark (December 13, 2007). Retrieved on 2010-12-27.{{cite news |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/175817 |title=Nude Paris launches 'wine in a can' (+photo) |work=[[Stuff.co.nz]] |accessdate=November 1, 2011}} She also traveled to Germany to promote the drink, appearing in various print ads for the product.{{Cite news |url = http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,316541,00.html |title = Paris Hilton Wears Nothing but Gold Paint for Champagne Ad |accessdate = December 31, 2007 |date=December 12, 2007 |work=[[Fox News|FOXNews.com]]}} Hilton's love for dogs led her to create an apparel line for dogs called Little Lily by Paris Hilton, with some of the proceeds going to benefit animal rescue. "I have 17 dogs and I like to dress them, so I started designing this clothing line and it's really cute, like dresses and jeans – everything you can imagine for humans, but for dogs," she said in an interview during [[Super Bowl XLII]] festivities.Gould, Mignon A. [http://www.mignongould.com/paris-talks-togs.pdf Paris Talks Togs — People's and Pet's]. 'Yes Magazine/The Arizona Republic'. February 8, 2008. news|url=http://www.tv.com/story/10960.html |title=Cast updates: Her Name is Paris |first=Tim |last=Surette |work=TV.com |date=April 3, 2008}} On August 6, 2008, Hilton appeared in a video online, ''Paris Hilton Responds to McCain Ad'', directed by [[Adam McKay]] and posted on the [[Funny or Die]] website.{{cite news|url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/politics/2008/08/paris-hilton-re/|title=Paris advertising|campaign advert]] ''Celeb'', by the [[John McCain presidential campaign, 2008|2008 John McCain presidential campaign]].{{cite Hilton|publisher=CNN|accessdate=July 17, 2012|date=July 25, 2008}} In what ''[[The Washington Post]]'' opined "might just be her best acting role yet,"{{Cite news|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/08/06/AR2008080601084.html |title=Paris for Prez? |first=Jose Antonio |last=Vargas |work=Washington Post |date=August 6, 2008 |accessdate=May 2, 2012}} Hilton appears in the video wearing a [[leopard]] print [[swimsuit]].{{Cite news|first=Jay |last=Fitzgerald|title=Paris Hilton electrifies campaign |url=http://www.bostonherald.com/news/national/politics/2008/view.bg?articleid=1111580&srvc=rss |publisher=Boston Herald |date=August 7, 2008 |accessdate=August 20, 2008}} The video received seven million views in two days garnering worldwide press coverage, and drew both written and verbal media response from both campaigns.{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/paris-for-president-ndash-and-shes-gunning-for-mccain-887111.html|title=Paris for President – and she's gunning for McCain|work=The Independent|accessdate=July 27, 2012|location=London|first=Rupert|last=Cornwell|date=August 7, 2008}} In October Hilton featured in a second parody video posted on ''[[Funny or Die]]'', ''Paris Hilton news|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20231900,00.html|title=VIDEO: Paris Hilton Gets (Fake) Presidential Advice – From Martin Sheen|work=People|accessdate=July 27, 2012}} Hilton, heavily made up and in a green evening dress, interviews Martin Sheen in a kitchen, discussing various political issues, seeking his advice from his days playing a fictional President on ''[[The West Wing]]''.{{Cite news|title=Paris Hilton is joined by Martin Sheen for her fake US presidential campaign|work=The Times |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/article4910791.ece|first=Sophie|last=Tedmanson|date=October 9, 2008|location=London}} [[File:Paris Hilton Tiff 09.jpg|thumb|upright|right|Hilton at the premiere of documentary ''[[Paris, Not France]]'' at the [[2008 Toronto International Film Festival]].]] A the [[2008 Toronto International Film Festival]], it was screened a documentary about Hilton called ''[[Paris, Not France]]''.{{cite news|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/2008/09/10/us-toronto-hilton-idINN1040315820080910|title=Paris Hilton lights up Toronto film festival|agency=Reuters|accessdate=May 19, 2012|date=September 10, 2008}} "I think there's a lot of misconceptions in the media. This movie is very personal. It's kind of like a diary", she said about the motion picture.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1617137/paris-not-france-gets-inside-paris-hiltons-life.jhtml|title='Paris, Not France' Aims To Reveal The Real Paris Hilton|publisher=''MTV''|accessdate=May 19, 2012}} Hilton admitted that when she talked with the movie director Adria Petty, she "broke it down to her and talked about things that have never been spoken about before, and people will learn a lot from that". It is shown in the documentary how she felt about the way the media had portrayed her: "I'm basically being judged, and they're creating this false person, and I can't do anything about it".{{cite news|url=http://www.usatoday.com/life/movies/2008-09-09-2294854685_x.htm|title=Paris doc shows confessional side of Hilton|work=USA Today|accessdate=May 19, 2012|date=September 10, 2008}} Petty, during the premiere at the festival remarked that Hilton has "created a mystery about herself that a film like this maybe wouldn't have been a great thing for her in the past. But now, she's been so saturated in the media. We're so used to her. To see a new side of her is so exciting". Later, in 2009, the film was aired in July for MTV.{{cite web|url=http://perezhilton.com/2009-05-17-paris-not-france|title=Paris, Not France|publisher=Perez Hilton|accessdate=May 19, 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://blogs.orlandosentinel.com/entertainment_tv_tvblog/2009/07/paris-hilton-mtv-offer-a-look-at-her-life-in-paris-not-france.html|title=Paris Hilton, MTV offer a look at her life in ‘Paris, Not France’|publisher=Orlandosentinel.com|accessdate=May 19, 2012}} Hilton starred in an MTV reality series titled ''[[Paris Hilton's My New BFF]]'', about her search for a new best friend.{{Cite news|first=Dave|last=West|title=Hilton will seek best friend in new show|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/ustv/a91546/hilton-will-seek-best-friend-in-new-show.html|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|date=March 14, 2008|accessdate=March 15, 2008}} The series premiered on September 30, 2008.{{Cite news|title=Hilton searching for new best friend|url=http://www.rte.ie/arts/2008/0314/hiltonp.html|publisher=[[RTÉ]]|date=March 14, 2008|accessdate=March 17, 2008}} That day, Hilton released her song "My BFF" on [[KIIS-FM]] with host [[Ryan Seacrest]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/gossip/2008/09/30/2008-09-30_check_out_paris_hiltons_new_single_my_bf.html |title=Check out Paris Hilton's new single, 'My BFF' |first=Korin |last=Miller |date=September 30, 2008|location=New York|work=Daily News}}Hilton, Paris (September 30, 2008). {{MP3link|[http://a1135.g.akamai.net/f/1135/18227/1h/cchannel.download.akamai.com/18227/podcast/LOSANGELES-CA/KIIS-FM/parishilton093008.mp3 Radio interview]|15.5 MB}} on [[KIIS-FM]] by host [[Ryan Seacrest]]. Retrieved October 3, 2008. It was the theme song for the ''BFF'' show . The series proved to be a hit; it was watched in its premiere episode by 1,200,000 viewers and averaged a 1.6 rating among spectators 12–34 in its Tuesday 10 p.m slot, topping all other cable shows in the hour.{{cite web|last=Fitzgerald |first=Toni |url=http://www.medialifemagazine.com/artman2/publish/Cable_20/So-hot_Paris_and_hot_all_over_again.asp |title=So-hot Paris, and hot all over again |publisher=Media Life Magazine |date=October 22, 2008 |accessdate=2012-05-24}} Hilton played the character of Amber Sweet, the surgery- and painkiller-addicted daughter of a biotech magnate in the goth/rock musical with a [[cult film]] following, ''[[Repo! The Genetic Opera]]''.{{cite web|last=Nudd |first=Tim |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20048817,00.html |title=Paris Hilton Singing a New Tune: Opera – Paris Hilton |work=People |date=July 30, 2007 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} ''Horror.com'' said: " Not only is this by far Hilton's best role, she's actually got a grain of gravitas in the end".{{cite web|url=http://www.horror.com/php/article-1909-1.html|title=Repo! The Genetic Opera Interview with Director Darren Lynn Bousman and Actress Paris Hilton |publisher=Upcoming-movies.com |date=April 24, 2008 |accessdate=2012-05-24}} She was nominated for the [[Razzie Award for Worst Supporting Actress]] in 2009 for her role.{{cite web|url=http://voices.yahoo.com/2009-razzi-award-nominees-2654011.html |title=2009 Razzi Award Nominees – Yahoo! Voices |publisher=voices.yahoo.com |date=February 20, 2009 |accessdate=2012-08-10}} The film, first screened at the 2008 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]], received a [[limited release]] in the United States and Canada on November 7, 2008.[http://www.comingsoon.net/films.php?id=22928 Repo! The Genetic Opera (2008)] Coming Soon Around that time, Hilton released her fifth fragrance for women called, ''Fairy Dust''.{{cite web|url=http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/8002|title=Fairy Dust by Paris Hilton Fragrance|publisher=Clevelandleader.com|accessdate=May 19, 2012}} ===2009–2011: Worldwide TV career=== As a result of the American version success, on January 29, 2009, ''[[Paris Hilton's British Best Friend]]'', a spin-off, began airing on ITV2 in England.{{cite web|author=Leigh Holmwood |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/media/2008/aug/20/itv.television |title=Paris Hilton's first UK show leads ITV2 autumn lineup|work=The Guardian |accessdate=2012-09-05}} She began to film the show in October 2008.{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/hi/entertainment/newsid_7681000/7681560.stm |title=Paris 'finds the paps scary' |publisher=BBC News |date=October 21, 2008 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} She said that she would not leave London until she could "find that amazing girl or guy who can meet the challenges of being" her "British bestie".{{Cite news|url=http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/celebrity-news/tv-news/274340/paris-hilton-london-is-my-favourite-city-in-the-world/1|title=Paris Hilton: London is my favourite city in the world|publisher=Now Magazine|accessdate=March 24, 2012}} She also felt that her friend had to be "hot", "can keep up" with her – it had to be somebody who "is real and won't be a backstabber".{{Cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/article1584040.ece|title=Paris wants a new best friend|publisher=The Sun|accessdate=March 24, 2012|location=London}} The show did quite well; it was watched by 428,000 viewers in its first episode{{cite web|url=http://www.parishiltonsite.net/paris-hiltons-british-best-friend-improves-its-ratings/ |title=Paris Hilton’s British Best Friend improves its ratings |publisher=Parishiltonsite.net |accessdate=2012-05-24}} and brought 605,000 viewers for its finale.{{cite web|url=http://www.parishiltonsite.net/finale-of-paris-hiltons-british-best-friend-beats-all-previous-ratings/ |title=Finale of Paris Hilton’s British Best Friend beats all previous ratings |publisher=Parishiltonsite.net |accessdate=2012-05-24}} The second season of ''[[Paris Hilton's My New BFF (season 2)|Paris Hilton's My New BFF]]'' premiered on June 2, 2009. In that same month, Hilton shot ''[[Paris Hilton's Dubai BFF]]''{{Cite news| url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118004397.html?categoryid=19&cs=1|title=Paris Hilton pursues Mideast 'BFF'|first=Michael|last=Schneider|work=Variety|date=June 1, 2009}} (which, after some complication, it was aired in 2011). Runner-up of the British series Kat McKenzie died on July 3, 2009, of a suspected overdose.{{cite news| url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/2518348/Paris-TV-pal-dies-aged-25.html|location=London|work=The Sun|title=Paris TV pal dies aged 25|date=July 6, 2009}} Hilton guest-starred in the fifth episode of ''[[Supernatural (TV series)|Supernatural]]'''s fifth season.http://www.eonline.com/news/137862/paris-hilton-to-guest-star-on-cw-s-supernatural "Paris Hilton is playing a demonic creature that takes the form of ... Paris Hilton," creator and executive producer Eric Kripke said in a statement. "It'll be a fun, irreverent episode and we here at ''Supernatural'' are thrilled that Paris agreed to do it."{{Cite news| author=Joyce Eng|title=Paris Hilton to Haunt Supernatural|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Paris-Hilton-Guest-1008773.aspx|work=TVGuide.com|date=August 7, 2009|accessdate=August 7, 2009}} In July 2009, her sixth fragrance for women ''[[Siren (fragrance)|Siren]]'' was launched.{{cite web|url= http://www.theinsider.com/news/2301954_Paris_Hilton_To_Launch_Siren_Scent|title=Paris Hilton To Launch "Siren" Scent|publisher=The Insider|accessdate=August 25, 2009}} In February 2010, Hilton participated in an advertising campaign for the launch of the Brazilian beer [[Primo Schincariol|Devassa Bem Loura]], whose slogan in English roughly translates to "very blonde bitch".[http://oglobo.globo.com/economia/mat/2010/02/10/schincariol-anuncia-paris-hilton-como-garota-propaganda-da-nova-cerveja-devassa-915829912.asp Schincariol anuncia Paris Hilton como garota propaganda da nova cerveja Devassa]. ''O Globo''. February 10, 2010. As part of the campaign, Hilton joined the brewery's float in the [[Rio Carnival|carnival of Rio de Janeiro]].[http://carnaval.ig.com.br/noticias/riodejaneiro/2010/02/10/pela+primeira+vez+no+carnaval+do+rio+paris+hilton+deve+comemorar+o+aniversario+na+cidade+9393492.html Pela primeira vez no carnaval do Rio, Paris Hilton deve comemorar o aniversário na cidade]. ''IG''. February 10, 2010. Despite the buzz caused by Hilton in Rio de Janeiro, Devassa beer had captured just 0.2% of the market at the end of 2010.[http://www.bahianoticias.com.br/noticias/noticia/2010/12/16/81354,schin-perde-mercado-mesmo-com-paris-hilton.html Devassa Market Share]. ''Bahia Noticias''. December 16, 2010. Hilton launched her 10th fragrance, ''Tease'' inspired by [[Marilyn Monroe]] in August 2010.[http://main.stylelist.com/2010/08/11/paris-hilton-tease-perfume/ Paris Hilton 'Tease' Perfume Launch an Ode to Marilyn Monroe – StyleList]. Main.stylelist.com (August 11, 2010). Retrieved on 2011-10-28. Hilton provided her voice for the character of Bella in the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] made-for-television film ''[[The Dog Who Saved Christmas Vacation]]'' (it is her first voice-over role).{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Mario-Lopez-Interview-1026130.aspx |title=Mario Lopez Shares 5 Reasons to Watch The Dog Who Saved Christmas Vacation – Today's News: Our Take |publisher=TVGuide.com |date=November 27, 2010 |accessdate=2012-09-05}} She said of the film: "I just think it's a really cute film" and that "I love animal movies, I love Christmas movies, and also, my grandmother, who passed away a couple of years ago from breast cancer, actually had a standard poodle and her name was Paris. It's kind of like a sign to me."{{Cite news|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/paris_hilton_going_dogs_this_christmas/210788?utm_source=eonline&utm_medium=rssfeeds&utm_campaign=imdb_topstories|title=Paris Hilton Going to the Dogs This Christmas|work= E! Online|accessdate= November 27, 2011}} The film aired on November 28, 2010 and attracted good ratings with 2.611 million viewers.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/11/30/sunday-cable-ratings-boardwalk-empiredips-soul-train-awards-real-housewives-dexter-top-gear-more/73858/|title=Sunday Cable Ratings: Boardwalk Empire Dips; Soul Train Awards, Real Housewives, Dexter, Top Gear & More|publisher=By the numbers|accessdate=April 26, 2012}} In December 2010 Hilton launched her own motorcycle team.[http://www.popeater.com/2010/12/20/paris-hilton-motorcyle-supermartxe-vip/ Paris Hilton Launches Motorcycle Racing Team]. PopEater.com (December 20, 2010). Retrieved on 2011-10-28. "I can't believe I have my own racing team! So cool!", Hilton wrote on her Twitter while at the launch. The team, whose colors are pink, white and blue, is competing in the MotoGP 125cc category from 2011–2013.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-31749_162-20026222-10391698.html|title=Paris Hilton Launches Own Motorcycle Racing Team|publisher=Cbsnews.com|accessdate=April 26, 2012}} In November 2011, her Spanish driver Maverick Vinales won the final race and come up third overall in the 125cc world championship.{{cite web|url=http://www.hellomagazine.com/celebrities/201111076495/paris-hilton-motogp-team-wins/ |title=Paris Hilton expands her empire with her own winning MotoGP racing team |work=hello! |date=November 7, 2011 |accessdate=2012-08-10}} [[File:ParisHiltonFeb2011.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Hilton at her birthday party at LAVO nightclub on February 17, 2011.]] Later that year, [[Oxygen (TV channel)|Oxygen Channel]] gave the go-ahead to a new reality show called ''[[The World According to Paris]]''. The show followed Hilton in her daily life,{{cite news| url=http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE6905L920101001|work=Reuters|first=Jill|last=Serjeant|title=Paris Hilton to show her real life in new TV show|date=October 1, 2010}} and premiered in June 1, 2011 to 409,000 viewers. Although being the highest Wednesday premiere for a show,{{cite news|author=Canada |url=http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/arts/video/video-paris-hilton-defends-reality-show-bomb/article2051615/ |title=Video: Paris Hilton defends reality show bomb |work=Globe and Mail |location=Canada |date= June 8, 2011|accessdate=2012-05-24 |location=Toronto}} it was considered a bomb, which led to the suspicion Hilton's popularity had faded.http://www.sfexaminer.com/entertainment/scoop/2011/06/paris-hilton-s-star-appears-be-fading ''[[The New York Times]]'' wrote that Hilton "is an attractive woman with proven talent for marketing and self-promotion, though as a reality heroine she seems a little passé — a Sony Walkman in an iPod era, a Friendster in the age of Facebook or, to put it in context, a single-process blonde in a triple-process world", and also remarked that she "appears to have plenty of boyfriends, present and ex. Paparazzi still snap her picture. But it’s hard to see how she can recapture the kind of audience she enjoyed in her heyday – even by streaming her premiere live on Facebook".{{cite news|url=http://tv.nytimes.com/2011/06/01/arts/television/paris-hilton-in-the-world-according-to-paris.html|title=In a Bentley, Trying to Catch the Spotlight Again|work=The New York Times|accessdate=May 10, 2012|first=Alessandra|last=Stanley|date=May 31, 2011}} She also modeled for Brazil fashion week in 2010 and 2011 In São Paulo, Brazil.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1285826/Sao-Paulo-Fashion-Week-Paris-Hilton-flirts-way-catwalk-closes-show.html Sao Paulo Fashion Week: Paris Hilton flirts her way down the catwalk as she closes the show | Mail Online]. Dailymail.co.uk. Retrieved on 2011-10-28. In 2011, it was launched a new collection of fragrances called the Passport collection.
